did.abstract: The National Museum of the American Indian (NMAI) is part of the Smithsonian Institution and is dedicated to the life, languages, literature, history, and arts of the Native Americans of the Western Hemisphere. From 1979 until 2011 the museum supported the Native Film + Video Film Festival to focus on the creative works, concerns, and achievements of Native filmmakers. This collection consists of materials created and collected by the NMAI in the course of their efforts to collect, preserve, and make accessible film and video works created by indigenous artists, the majority of which are associated with the Native American Film and Video Festival. Materials include the paper-based administrative files of the collecting efforts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred to New York University from the National Museum of the American Indian (NMAI) in 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.034.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor. Materials are in rough alphabetical order by artist's name.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The National Museum of the American Indian (NMAI) is part of the Smithsonian Institution and is dedicated to the life, languages, literature, history, and arts of the Native Americans of the Western Hemisphere. From 1979 until 2011 the museum supported the Native Film + Video Film Festival to focus on the creative works, concerns, and achievements of Native filmmakers. The first Festival's success led to the creation of the museum's Film and Video Center (FVC) and of a published reference catalog that was drawn from Festival programming, Native Americans on Film and Video, Vol. I (1981) and Vol. II (1988).

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Materials in this collection were collected and created by the National Museum of the American Indian (NMAI) in the course of the Native American Film + Video Festival between 1979 and 2011. The collection was transferred to New York University in 2015.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and described by an archivist. Materials were kept in their original folders and no other physical interventions were taken at this time.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials created and collected by the National Museum of the American Indian in the course of their efforts to collect, preserve, and make accessible film and video works created by indigenous artists, the majority of which are associated with the Native American Film and Video Festival. Materials in this collection include the paper-based administrative files of the collecting efforts, including artist files and publications associated with various aspects of Native American and indigenous art.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by the National Museum of the American Indian, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
